newsitem.title: USA: North Sea Brent plunges in late U.S. paper trading.
newsitem.headline: North Sea Brent plunges in late U.S. paper trading.

text.p: North Sea Brent plunged in late U.S. paper trading on Tuesday amid continued pressure from ample physical supplies, traders said.
Eight partial May cargoes changed hands at between $18.95 and $19.02 a barrel, down from $19.09 at the settlement of the International Petroleum Exchange (IPE) in London.

Intermonth spreads were subdued. May/June Brent was talked at minus 15 to minus 13 cents a barrel, slightly stronger than indicated by the day's earlier transactions of minus 16 cents and minus 17 cents.
June/July was talked around minus three cents to flat, also slightly firmer from before the close.
